Detailed Description

Contains static functions to compute with referneces used for Drag&Drop and for hyperlinks used in HTML.

Author:
The BibleTime team

const QString CReferenceManager::encodeHyperlink (  const QString & module,
const QString & key,
const Type & type

Returns a hyperlink used to be imbedded in the display windows.

At the moment the format is sword://module/key

const QString CReferenceManager::encodeReference (  const QString & module,
const QString & reference
)  [static]
 

Puts a module Name and a Reference together in the 'draggable' form (module)reference.

Parameters:
module   The name of the module
reference   The key reference as text
Returns:
The encoded reference using module and reference
Author:
Martin Gruner

const QString CReferenceManager::parseVerseReference (  const QString ref,
const QString & lang,
const QString & newLang = "en"
)  [static]
 

Parses the given verse references using the given language and the module.

Parameters:
ref   The verse refernce
lang   The language of the verse reference
newLang   The language of the reference, which will be returned. For example: If BibleTime using an english environment parses a spanish ref (lang=es) the returned ref should be in english (newLang=en), because his english standard module only understands en.
